description.value:
The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d10 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d6 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d8 + @mod type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} and aware of it must succeed on a [[/save wis 18 format=long]] or become &Reference[frightened]{frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} uses one of the following breath weapons:

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} exhales &Reference[fire]{fire} in an 90-foot &Reference[line]{line} that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that &Reference[line]{line} must make a [[/save dex 21 format=long]], taking [[/damage 16d6 type=fire average=true]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} exhales sleep gas in a 90-foot &Reference[cone]{cone}. Each creature in that area must succeed on a [[/save con 21 format=long]] or fall &Reference[unconscious]{unconscious} for 10 minutes. This effect ends for a creature if the creature takes damage or someone uses an action to wake it.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} magically polymorphs into a &Reference[humanoid]{humanoid} or &Reference[beast]{beast} that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the dragon's choice).

In a new form, the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} retains its alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, lair actions, and &Reference[int]{Intelligence}, &Reference[wis]{Wisdom}, and &Reference[cha]{Charisma} scores, as well as this action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Lair Actions

On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects:

  • A strong wind blows around the &Reference[dragon]{dragon}. Each creature within 60 feet of the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} must succeed on a [[/save str 15 format=long]] or be pushed 15 feet away from the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} and knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}. Gases and vapors are dispersed by the wind, and unprotected flames are extinguished. Protected flames, such as lanterns, have a 50 percent chance of being extinguished.
  • A cloud of sand swirls about in a 20-foot-radius &Reference[sphere]{sphere} centered on a point the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can see within 120 feet of it. The cloud spreads around corners. Each creature in it must succeed on a [[/save con 15 format=long]] or be &Reference[blinded]{blinded} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Regional Effects

The region containing a legendary brass dragon’s lair is warped by the dragon’s magic, which creates one or more of the following effects:

  • Tracks appear in the sand within 6 miles of the dragon’s lair. The tracks lead to safe shelters and hidden water sources, while also leading away from areas that the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} prefers to remain undisturbed.
  • Images of Large or smaller monsters haunt the desert sands within 1 mile of the dragon’s lair. These illusions move and appear real, although they can do no harm. A creature that examines an image from a distance can tell it’s an &Reference[ill]{illusion} with a successful DC 20 &Reference[int]{Intelligence} (&Reference[inv]{Investigation}) check. Any physical interaction with an image reveals it to be an &Reference[ill]{illusion}, because objects pass through it.
  • Whenever a creature with an &Reference[int]{Intelligence} of 3 or higher comes within 30 feet of a water source within 1 mile of the dragon’s lair, the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} becomes aware of the creature’s presence and location.

If the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} dies, the tracks fade in 1d10 days, but the other effects fade immediately.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

A Brass Dragon’s Lair

A brass dragon’s desert lair is typically a ruin, canyon, or cave network with ceiling holes to allow for sunlight.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 2d8 + @mod type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Detect. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} makes a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} (&Reference[prc]{Perception}) check.

Tail Attack. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} makes a tail attack.

Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions). The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} beats its wings. Each creature within 15 feet of the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} must succeed on a [[/save dex 22 format=long]] or take [[/damage 2d6 + 8 type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage and be knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can then fly up to half its flying speed.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} makes a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} (&Reference[prc]{Perception}) check.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} beats its wings. Each creature within 15 feet of the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} must succeed on a [[/save dex 22 format=long]] or take [[/damage 2d6 + 8 type=bludgeoning average=true]] damage and be knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} can then fly up to half its flying speed.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Legendary Resistance (3/Day). If the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].
